snippet: Overall sales rose 4.3 percent in July, according to a Thomson Reuters survey, although stores that cater to teenagers reported a drop.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports sales at 20 stores open at least a year rose 4.3 percent in July, well above expectations of a 1.5 percent gain; teenage-oriented stores had 4.2 percent sales drop.
lead_paragraph: Overall sales rose 4.3 percent in July, according to a Thomson Reuters survey, although stores that cater to teenagers reported a drop.

headline.seo: Retailers Beat Expectations, Helped by Midpriced Stores
headline.main: Retailers Beat Expectations, Helped by Midpriced Stores
headline.print_headline: Retailers Beat Forecasts Over All, But Teenagers Cut Their Shopping
